about.title: About Us
about.content:
SORA Tattoo stands for clarity, precision, and artistic freedom.
Our studio in Berlin is a place where ideas take shape and personal stories become visible.
We don't work with a rigid surface, but with the body in motion – lines follow rhythm, flow, and natural dynamics.
For us, skin is not a canvas substitute, but part of the composition.
Emptiness doesn't mean absence, but balance – a conscious pause within the entire visual dialogue.
With care, transparency, and the highest standards of quality and safety, each tattoo emerges as part of a greater whole.

chooseArtist.title: How to Choose the Right Tattoo Artist?
chooseArtist.content:
Each artist at SORA has their own signature and works in different styles.
Pay attention to the style, line work, and how motifs are structured.
Equally important is the personal feeling – whether you feel understood and well taken care of.
A tattoo is a collaborative process that requires time, trust, and calm.
Take that time – we're happy to guide you through it.

prepare.title: How Do I Prepare for a Tattoo Appointment?
prepare.content:
Good preparation helps you experience the tattoo appointment relaxed.
Make sure you're well-rested, have eaten well, and drink enough water.
Avoid alcohol and drugs at least 24 hours before the appointment.
Wear comfortable clothing and take your time – calm and a good feeling are part of the process.
If you have questions, we're always here for you.

session.title: What to Expect During the Tattoo Session?
session.content:
The tattoo appointment begins with a calm conversation about your motif and placement.
Together we go through the details before the process starts.
During the session, we take our time, take breaks, and pay attention to your well-being.
You can ask questions at any time or let us know if you need a break.
Your comfort and a good feeling are our top priority.

aftercare.title: Tattoo Care & Healing
aftercare.intro:
Good aftercare is crucial for a beautiful and lasting result.
Please follow these guidelines – they help your skin heal optimally.

method1.title: Option 1 — Healing with Protective Film (Second Skin)
method1.description: After the tattoo, a special protective film is applied to the skin.
steps: The film stays on the skin for 3–5 days, depending on your artist's recommendation.
During this time, it protects the tattoo from bacteria, friction, and dirt.
If fluid collects under the film, this is normal.
If the film comes off prematurely or becomes very uncomfortable, remove it carefully.
method1.afterRemoval:
After removing the film:
• Wash the tattoo with lukewarm water and a mild, unscented soap.
• Gently pat the skin dry (do not rub).
• Apply a thin layer of tattoo care cream.
• Care for the tattoo 2–3 times daily.

method2.title: Option 2 — Healing with Compress
method2.description: After the appointment, the tattoo is covered with a compress.
steps: Wash the tattoo thoroughly with lukewarm water and mild soap.
Apply a thin layer of care cream.
method2.followingDays:
In the following days:
• Wash the tattoo 2–3 times daily.
• Apply a thin layer of cream each time.
• The skin should not dry out, but also not 'suffocate'.

important.title: Important Notes for Both Options
points: Do not pull on scabs or skin flakes.
No bathing, sauna, tanning, or swimming for at least 2–3 weeks.
Wear loose, clean clothing over the tattoo.

healing.title: Healing Process
healing.content:
• In the first days, the skin may be red, sensitive, or slightly swollen – this is normal.
• Itching is part of the healing process, please do not scratch.
• Complete healing takes about 2–4 weeks, deeper skin layers longer.

aftercare.support:
If you're unsure or have questions, feel free to contact us anytime.
We'll support you even after the tattoo – your well-being is important to us.
